signingKeys.revokeWarning: After revoking this key, all tokens signed with it will become invalid immediately. Please ensure a new key is activated.
signingKeys.cleanupDescription: This operation will delete expired and inactive keys. Active keys will not be deleted.

gdpr.title: GDPR Compliance Management
gdpr.rightsDescription: According to GDPR requirements, users have the following rights:
gdpr.rightPortability: Right to Data Portability: Users can request export of their personal data
gdpr.rightErasure: Right to Erasure: Users can request deletion or anonymization of their personal data
gdpr.auditNote: All operations will be recorded in the audit log
gdpr.exportTitle: Right to Data Portability (Export User Data)
gdpr.exportDescription: Export complete user personal data, including:
gdpr.exportFormatDescription: Data will be exported in JSON format with complete metadata and timestamps.
gdpr.deleteWarning: Deletion is irreversible, please proceed with caution! It's recommended to export data backup first.
gdpr.deleteSoftInfo1: Personal information replaced with anonymous values
gdpr.deleteSoftInfo2: Revoke all API keys and sessions
gdpr.deleteSoftInfo5: Does not affect associated audit logs
gdpr.deleteHard: Hard Delete (Permanent Deletion) - Use with Caution
gdpr.rightPortabilityDesc: Users have the right to receive their personal data in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format and have the right to transmit that data to another controller.
gdpr.rightErasureDesc: Users have the right to request deletion of their personal data. We provide both soft delete (anonymization) and hard delete options, recommending soft delete to maintain audit trails.
gdpr.auditTrailDesc: All GDPR-related operations are fully recorded in the audit log, including operator, operation time, operation type, and other information.
gdpr.responseTimeDesc: According to GDPR requirements, data subject requests should be responded to within 30 days. This system can process requests immediately.

notificationSettings.title: Notification Settings
notificationSettings.subtitle: Configure system email notification features
notificationSettings.unsavedChangesDesc: You have modified notification settings. Please click the [Save All Settings] button to save changes.
notificationSettings.riskScoreHelp: (0-39: Low Risk, 40-69: Medium Risk, 70-100: High Risk)
notificationSettings.anomalousLoginDesc: When anomalous login behavior is detected (such as login from different location, unusual time, new device, etc.) and the risk score reaches the threshold, the system will automatically send an email notification to the user.
notificationSettings.anomalousLoginRules: Detection Rules: Different Location +40 points, Unusual Time +20 points, New Device +15 points, High Frequency Login +30 points, Rapid IP Switch +35 points
notificationSettings.newDeviceDesc: When a user logs in from a device they have never used before, the system will automatically send an email notification to the user, including device information, login time and location details.
notificationSettings.passwordChangedDesc: When a user successfully changes their password, the system will automatically send a confirmation email to the user, including the time of change. It is recommended to keep this enabled to improve account security.
notificationSettings.accountLockedDesc: When a user account is locked due to multiple failed login attempts or other security reasons, the system will automatically send a notification email to the user, explaining the reason for locking and how to unlock.
notificationSettings.mfaEnabledDesc: When a user successfully enables multi-factor authentication (MFA), the system will automatically send a confirmation email to the user, including the time of enablement. It is recommended to keep this enabled to improve account security.

webhooks.name: Name
